200.description: Call ring details were fetched successfully.

get.description: Lists short numbers's call tracking rules.

200.description: Call tracking rules were fetched successfully.

put.description: Registers call tracking rules for specified short number. Current implementation provides email reporting of calls that were answered/unanswered.

get.description: Reads configuration details of a company.

put.description: Updates the configuration details of a company.

delete.description: Removes a company. Short numbers belonging to the removed company are also removed.

post.description: Company is a logical unit within project. Short numbers, IVRs, etc. belong to one and only one company.

get.description: Lists all short numbers belonging to particular company.

200.description: List of short numbers was fetched successfully.

get.description: Download file from the server by id
Reads number details. USE /number.json ENDPOINT INSTEAD!

Project can be considered as a top-level 'account' on Tempo Platform. Username and password of the API access are the credentials of the project. All interfaces in this API create/read/update/delete resources that belong to the project. Removing the project removes all resources allocated by the project.

200.description: List of companies were fetched successfully.

get.description: Lists all templates that are available in this project.

200.description: List of templates was fetched successfully.

put.description: Updates the configuration of an existing short number or configures a new short number if it doesn't exist.  Short numbers can be dialed like regular numbers but unlike regular numbers short numbers cannot be registered to a phone. As a consequence short numbers are always redirected to some regular number(s). A short number can be redirected to different  list of numbers depending on the date and time of the call. start_date, start_time, end_date, end_time, weekday_mask attributes  define when numbers in call list are applicable. If date and time rules of multiple RedirectTo objects match the first one in the list is used.

200.description: Short number details were fetched successfully.

delete.description: Removes a short number and all associated call tracking rules.

200.description: Short number details were fetched successfully.

post.description: Templates are used within Tempo Platform to construct variable-dependant strings. Template format is [mustache](https://mustache.github.io/)

files.description: different language versions of the announcement
different language versions of the announcement

call.description: phone numbers that will be called. numbers are tried for answer in order from first to last. hunting stops once some number answers or the end of the list is reached.

ringing_timeout.description: number of seconds to let it ring without answer before trying next number in call list

answer_preferences.description: '1' means 'do not confirm call answer with DTMF', '0' means 'use recipients answer preferences', '2' means 'confirm answer with DTMF'

company_id.description: identifier of call ring's parent company

email.description: recipient of the call tracking report

message_template_id.description: identifier of the template used to construct the body of the email

subject_template_id.description: identifier of the template used to construct the subject of the email

event.description: type of the event that triggers reporting

voiplocation_code.description: Town code that matches phone's physical location

email.description: email address of project's contact person

short_number.description: short number as it would be dialed

company_id.description: identifier of short number's parent company

Response401.description: Access is denied. Invalid or no credentials were provided.

Response404.description: Resource was not found. Path parameters didn't match any resource.

ResponseNewResource.description: Operation was successful. Returned data contains the id of newly created resource.

ResponseNewResources.description: Operation was successful. Returned data contains the ids of newly created resources.

ResponseNewPassword.description: Operation was successful. Returned data contains the new password.
